cluster_relations.rel_desc: Understanding body language helps individuals navigate social situations more easily and effectively.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject factor or behavior makes it easier to achieve, experience, or improve the object outcome or state, without guaranteeing it.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: understanding these subtleties of body language

remarks: Assumes the understanding is of body language; subject kept as body language for simplicity.
Assumes the understanding is of body language; subject kept as body language for simplicity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Effective use and reading of body language helps people connect with others.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavior or communication pattern makes it easier to achieve or enhances the likelihood/quality of the interpersonal state or social outcome described by the object.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: By becoming more attuned to the signals

remarks: Subject chosen as body language rather than individuals to emphasize the communicative channel.
Subject chosen as body language rather than individuals to emphasize the communicative channel.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavior, signal, or factor makes it easier to achieve, enhances the likelihood of, or improves the quality of the social or interpersonal outcome described by the object, without guaranteeing it.
args.justification: Both relations describe body language making a social or interpersonal outcome (navigating social situations, connecting with others) easier or more effective, without deterministically causing it. They already share the canonical name 'facilitates' but have slightly divergent canonical descriptions and different, overlapping relation classes. Unifying them under a single description and a more general yet specific class 'social_outcome_facilitation_relation' provides a consistent schema while preserving their causal-enablement semantics within the CAUSALITY group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavior, signal, or factor makes it easier to achieve, enhances the likelihood of, or improves the quality of the social or interpersonal outcome described by the object, without guaranteeing it.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe body language making a social or interpersonal outcome (navigating social situations, connecting with others) easier or more effective, without deterministically causing it. They already share the canonical name 'facilitates' but have slightly divergent canonical descriptions and different, overlapping relation classes. Unifying them under a single description and a more general yet specific class 'social_outcome_facilitation_relation' provides a consistent schema while preserving their causal-enablement semantics within the CAUSALITY group.
